Mau Hapus Monopoli Tol Laut, Kemenhub Ngadu ke KPPU
01 Nov 2019, 09:03 by Anisa Indraini


Foto: Ari Saputra

Jakarta - Kementerian Perhubungan (Kemenhub) mengungkap monopoli swasta di program Tol Laut. Monopoli diduga terjadi di daerah Indonesia timur seperti Maluku dan Papua.Mengatasi masalah tersebut, Direktur Lalu Lintas dan Angkutan Laut Kementerian Perhubungan Wisnu Handoko mengatakan pihaknya akan meminta saran kepada Komisi Pengawas Persaingan Usaha (KPPU)."Saya rapat dengan KPPU besok Sabtu, (di) Surabaya bagaimana cara menanganinya," tutur Wisnu di Kementerian Perhubungan, Jakarta Pusat, Jumat (1/11/2019).Wisnu sendiri berencana membuat aturan untuk mengusut pihak swasta yang menguasai pengiriman barang di jalur tol laut. Menurutnya, sanksi terkait aturan pelarangan praktik monopoli harus dipertegas seperti peringatan, pencabutan izin, hingga pidana."Kalo sudah diidentifikasi terjadi monopoli harusnya tegas. Mulai dari peringatan sampai pencabutan izin. Kalo perlu dia ini ada pasal pidananya ya mungkin perlu dipidanakan," imbuhnya.Sebelumnya, Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) menyinggung soal program tol laut. Menurutnya ada pihak swasta yang menguasainya. Jadi barang-barang yang dikirim ke pulau-pulau dikendalikan oleh pihak swasta. Hal itu disebut akan mengganggu harga di sekitar pulau-pulau di Indonesia.Padahal, program tol laut dilakukan demi menurunkan harga-harga di pulau-pulau di Indonesia. Selama ini harga barang di wilayah pelosok Indonesia terbilang mahal karena arus logistik sulit menjangkaunya. Wanting to Erase the Sea Toll Monopoly, the Ministry of Transportation Ngadu to KPPU
01 Nov 2019, 09:03 by Anisa Indraini


Photo: Ari Saputra

Jakarta - The Ministry of Transportation (Kemenhub) revealed the private monopoly in the Sea Toll program. Monopoly is suspected to occur in eastern Indonesia such as Maluku and Papua. Overcoming this problem, the Director of Traffic and Sea Transportation at the Ministry of Transportation Wisnu Handoko said that he would ask for advice from the Business Competition Supervisory Commission (KPPU). "I will meet with the KPPU tomorrow Saturday, (at ) Surabaya how to handle it, "said Wisnu at the Ministry of Transportation, Central Jakarta, Friday (11/01/2019). Wisnu himself plans to make rules to prosecute the private sector that controls the delivery of goods in the sea toll lane. According to him, sanctions related to the prohibition of monopolistic practices must be emphasized such as warnings, revocation of licenses, until criminal. "If monopolies have been identified, they must be strict. From warnings to revocation of licenses. If necessary, there must be criminal penalties, yes, it may need to be criminalized," he added. Previously, President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) mentioned the sea toll program. According to him there are private parties who master it. So the goods sent to the islands are controlled by the private sector. It is said to be disrupting prices around islands in Indonesia. In fact, the sea toll program is carried out in order to reduce prices on islands in Indonesia. During this time the price of goods in remote areas of Indonesia is fairly expensive because of the logistical flow is difficult to reach.
